lines: Cold be hand and heart and bone... and cold be sleep under stone...
Never more to wake on stony bed... never... till the Sun fails and the Moon is dead...
In the black wind the stars shall die... and still on gold here let them lie...
Till the Dark Lord lifts up his hand... over dead sea and withered land...
Let me take you to my tomb...
Cold be heart and hand and bone... cold be travelers far from home...
They do not see what lies ahead... when sun has failed and moon is dead...
When winter first begins to bite... and stones crack in the frosty night... when pools are black and trees are bare...
Lost and forgotten be we... darker than darkness..
Cold now be heart and limb...
Alive without breath... as cold as death...
Nine for Mortal Men doomed to die...
One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne... in the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie...
One Ring to rule them all... one Ring to find them... one Ring to bring them all.. and in the darkness bind them...
Die now and curse in vain...
Far off yet is his doom... and not by the hand of man will he fall...
Let me take you back to my tomb...
What brings you to my tomb?...
